action.action-desc: Mr. Sessions (for himself, Mr. Comer, and Mr. Connolly) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the CARES Act to extend the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee through December 31, 2026, and to change the name of such Committee to the Fraud Prevention and Accountability Committee, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Accountability Committee for Transparency Act or the FACT Act.

section.header: Extension and name change of Pandemic Response Accountability Committee

subsection.text: Section 15010 of the CARES Act (Public Law 116–136; 134 Stat. 540; 5 U.S.C. 424 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking Pandemic Response Accountability Committee and inserting Fraud Prevention and Accountability Committee; and
in subsection (k), by striking September 30, 2025 and inserting December 31, 2026.

subsection.text: Section 15010 of the CARES Act (Public Law 116–136; 134 Stat. 540; 5 U.S.C. 424 note), as amended by the preceding subsection, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking Pandemic Response Accountability Committe and inserting Fraud Prevention and Accountability Committee; and
by striking section 6 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) and inserting section 406 of title 5, United States Code each place such phrase appears in such section;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(C), by inserting Government before Reform;
in paragraph (4), by striking section 11 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App) and inserting section 424 of title 5, United States Code; and
in paragraph (5), by striking Pandemic Response Accountability Committee and inserting Fraud Prevention and Accountability Committee; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking section 6 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App) and inserting section 406 of title 5, United States Code; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking section 4(b)(1) of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) inserting section 404(b)(1) of title 5, United States Code.

subsection.text: Any reference to the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee in any other Federal law, Executive order, rule, regulation, or delegation of authority, or any document of or pertaining to the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee, shall be deemed to refer to the Fraud Prevention and Accountability Committee.
